noun.description: A small settlement, generally one smaller than a village.

proper noun.description: A legendary prince of Denmark, hero of a tragedy by Shakespeare.

origin: Middle English: from Old French hamelet, diminutive of hamel little village; related to home ( hám in Old English).
phrases: I want people to watch this film as they would watch Hamlet without the Prince of Denmark in it, he says, adding later that the anger in me is now gone.
It was a bit like talking about Hamlet without the Prince of Denmark.
And The Taming of the Shrew without a shrew and a bully is like Hamlet without the Prince and the King.
Probably not; Hamlet without the Prince would not be so wonderful and the Grand Armée without Napoleon might not have been exactly the force it was.
Team Ireland continues like Hamlet without the Prince.
